Reviews.Content: Not so good Stayed for 10 nights in room 122, very noisey because of service gate .After that a fellow sweeps constantly, plus lots of loud talking hard to sleep in. Breakfast was ordinary. The staff where friendly, pool was nice . Rooms cleaned every day, overall average hotel.
Reviews.Author: suthowa

Reviews.Content: Loved the Puri Raja My boyfriend and I stayed at the Puri Raja for 6 nights in November 2008. I work in a travel agency in Perth Western Australia and was very much impressed with the Puri Raja. The renovation that has been completed for some time now has improved the rooms and grounds very much. The superior room we stayed in was very clean and quite modern. a very minimalist feel but a very functional room with fridge and in room safe. The split system air conditioning kept the room very cool. Bathroom was a good size with shower over the bath. Water pressure was excellent. We loved the small feel of the hotel and never had to fight for sun beds near the pools. We found the pool closest to the lobby to be a bit cooler in temperature than the beach end pool. The beach end pool was a bit like a warm bath sometimes.Food was great. They have the greatest banana pancakes ever for breakfast. Would highly recommend!!
Reviews.Author: savyagent2007

Reviews.Content: best ever...... we just got back from spending two weeks at puri raja. it was unreal. there's two pools - one at the front near the beach and one up the back near the reception. the rooms were basic but pretty good. the grounds were so nicely kept. the staff were unreal and friendly. starting the day off with breakfast overlooking the beach was tops. the breaky menu was awesome - fruit platters / american breakfast / omelettes / croissants / banana pancakes and heaps more. this was my 10th trip and i can definitely say i would stay there again. they were pretty booked out so book early if you want this place.
Reviews.Author: rosiefam

Reviews.Content: Perfect for our trip to Legian!       Pool with the restaurant in the background
Reviews.Author: pippi83

Reviews.Content: Not bad, but... We stayed 3 days in August. The room wasn't too bad but the price was bumped up to US$70 because it's high season. We wanted to stay for 4 nights, but when we booked, they said it was all booked out. When we actually arrived and were checking in, they were expecting us to stay 4 nights, but, I already booked somewhere else for another night because I was told no vacancy. They didn't look happy like 'you booked for 4 nights and now you're cancelling one night' kind of... Maybe all of a sudden they had a vacancy...I don't know, they never came back to inform me that. But, while we were staying the hotel didn't look fully occupied at all (?).Another thing was that I requested for a free transport from the airport before we got there which they refused and said it was US$10 for one way from the airport. So I didn't use it because I knew taxi was cheaper (about US$5 for prepaid taxi at the airport). When I arrived there by taxi, they said they arranged a transport for me at the airport to pick us up (not a free one). Again, they didn't look happy, But, I was annoyed by their self confirming for their own convenience without confirming/informing with their customers. The room was generally clean, but, for our last night, cleaners forgot to replace complimentary mineral water and replacing clean cups/glasses. Don't expect staff would be friendly all the time, maybe it was high season and they were getting enough customers without putting much efforts.One good thing about the hotel though is the it's restaurant where you eat breakfast. It's right on the beach which is quite nice.Don't book any trips at the hotel reception. It's heaps more expensive there. If you book through trip booking kiosks which you can find anywhere in the street in Kuta/Legian/Tuban, you can get big discounts. In Puri Raja, they charge you for the printed prices in the trip brochures.
Reviews.Author: newearth

Reviews.Content: Sssh, keep Puri Raja a secret... Puri Raja 鈥?what a find! I recently spent a week at Puri Raja for the first time on my 7th trip to Bali.Finally! I have found the perfect balance in a hotel. Just like Goldilocks with the three bears鈥t鈥檚 not too big, not too small - it鈥檚 just right!In the past I have stayed at other popular resorts like Padma, Santika, Legian Paradiso and Bounty. Puri Raja is quite different to all of these and oh so much better.It鈥檚 smaller than normal resorts鈥?72 rooms 鈥?and feels more intimate and personal. 68 Rooms are set out in two levels down a long avenue of immaculately kept gardens with 4 deluxe single storey rooms near the pool. It has a beachfront location at one end of the resort with gorgeous beach/sunset views and quick access to the local colourful streets of Legian at the other end.The rooms are simple, modern and convenient. Facilities are functional, recently updated and sufficient 鈥?air conditioning, tea/coffee, 2 bottles comp water, new-ish TV鈥檚 with limited cable stations, good water pressure and in-room safe. Beds are comfortable but linen and towels could be a touch 鈥渂righter鈥?and fresher but they are fine for a 3-star property.The balcony or veranda鈥檚 welcomed you for a late afternoon drink and a place to read or to sit and watch/chat with the other guests passing by.Most guests during my visit were Aussies and repeat guests. The average age range was early 30鈥檚 to 50鈥檚. This hotel would not be suitable for young party goers but definitely for the young at heart. Wear a smile and you鈥檒l meet many new friends.Breakfast served at the beachfront restaurant offered a wonderful vista. The breakfast is served cooked to order. This is unusual for many resorts in Bali who normally have breakfast buffets. I have mixed feelings about this. The positives were that the food was fresh and cooked to order but this is offset by time as sometimes service was slow. Sometimes there are mornings where you just want to help yourself and get going with your day.I disliked not having tea/coffee readily accessible 鈥?having to wait for it to be 鈥渟erved鈥?was a bit frustrating, especially for refills. My suggestion would be to have a self-serve tea/coffee/juice station. This would at least free staff up to focus on the food orders and give people something to keep them occupied while waiting for breakfast to be cooked.The pool located near reception (street end) was much quieter than the main pool. Rectangular, deep at one end with a few lounges and umbrellas. No food/beverage outlets in this area.The pool at beach end, near restaurant, was much more lively, larger and of varying depths. The swimming noodles provided were popular.There was a swim up pool bar and food/drinks served around the pool were reasonably priced even factoring in the tax/service and of OK quality.There were a number of sun lounge hogs (or should that be 鈥渉ogettes鈥? who used towels/magazines to reserve lounges in the early morning only to return later in the day to use them. There probably wasn鈥檛 any need because for the most part it was easy to find a lounge by the pool regardless of the time of day.We didn鈥檛 order any room service but I guess it was the same service as the restaurant so would have been fine.There鈥檚 no real extensive tour desk/concierge, day spa, tennis court, kids club or gym so if you really want these services Puri Raja is not for you. The hotel reception staff are friendly and accommodating for transfers, some tour advice and money exchange but if you want greater access to a hotel to provide lots of various services and facilities you should look elsewhere.When I wanted to experience day spa luxury I headed to the Mandara Spa at Hotel Padma where you can visit regardless of whether you are a guest or not. I chose a lengthy treatment package in their outdoor spa villas which was over $100USD.At the other end of the scale, the Lida Spa was a small beauty salon located in the local street just in front of the Melasti Resort that offered great 1 hour massages in simple air conditioned surrounds for about 50,000Rp.One unique feature of the Puri Raja is that it does offer pool side massages and mani/pedi treatments at comparable 鈥渟treet鈥?prices by friendly staff in shady areas around the resort.There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance for dining options that were all great. On the street side a short walk away was Posers, Poco Loco, Indo-National and Le Monde. Along the Legian Beach front Blue Ocean is recommended for a cool vibe, outstanding view and free internet.Puri Raja offers fantastic value for money in a quality resort for those that don鈥檛 need a full- service resort. It's certainly one of the top hotels for what they charge compared to other 3 star hotels.It鈥檚 no wonder the resort is often booked out. You could spend a lot more for a lesser standard hotel in Bali. I have in the past!Puri Raja is a fantastic resort that offers value for money for relaxed holiday makers. Let鈥檚 keep it that way and not let the secret out. Ssshh. I鈥檒l be back.
Reviews.Author: Veebes

Reviews.Content: a hidden oasis wow this place was better than what i thought it was gonna be, i found this hotel by reading everyones reviews on this site ,it really helped me pick a great hotel ,so im hoping it will help you make your decision too.this place was very clean ,they were always tidying the gardens and pathways.it is a smaller block of hotel villa style rooms ,all with balconys upstairs and verandahs downstairs,the rooms were spotless,tv ,fridge with complimentary water,and full of drinks to buy.plenty of storage space for all your shopping and our room had a safe,which was great so we could leave our money and passports in, you pick your own safe code.the bathroom has a bath and shower in one,very nice.if you book with breakfast included you only get the choice of the american breakfast which is, fruit platter or juice,eggs sauasage and bacon,croissant or toast,and ask for nescafe for your coffee coz bali coffee is not the greatest.the front reception is right on the street front in legianand then the hotel is long and narrow shaped and the other end of the hotel is directly acrooss to the beach ,no traffic at the beach end of the hotel as it is blocked off to cars so alot of people go walking along.next door was the melasti hotel and many people staying there wanted to move to the puri raja but this place is apparently booked well in advanced,i was going to choose the melasti but im glad i didnt ,puri raja is just so peacefull and quiet, many of the poeple staying here were older than us and we are in our late 30s,very quiet at nite so i got some great sleep,except for the fireworks that people kept setting off at kuta beach.easiest way to go into kuta was to walk along the beach ,we found that alot easier than trying to dodge all the shop people outside on the streets.there is 2 pools one at the road end where people read and tan ,very quiet pool and the pool at the beach end has the bar and music going.i can keep talking all day about this place ,i was really happy ,all staff friendly and always smiling ,we are planning on staying here again without a doubt.
Reviews.Author: kooching

Reviews.Content: Central Popular Hotel We have just returned from two weeks at the Puri Raja Hotel. The hotel rooms were very clean and comfortable and staff were very friendly and helpful. The grounds were very immaculate and the pools were clean and kept tidy.The breakfast was very good and fresh.Price of the hotel was excellent and right on the beach and so close to so many nice restaurants.We spent alot of time at the pool as they have a childrens pool as well and everyone was very friendly.We had a great stay and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: Holidaytime40

Reviews.Content: Real value for money We stayed at the Puri Raja for 5 nights this time, but would have stayed for longer but it was all booked out. We also stayed here on our first trip to Bali. We stayed at 7 hotels on this trip (including Hard Rock, Discovery Kartika) and it rated as our overall favourite. It is real value for money. The breakfast is great (especially as it isn't buffet so you don't over indulge) and the staff are also very friendly. The rooms are clean and tidy and it is a very quiet hotel. I like that there are 2 pools as well. The hotel isn't very big which was a plus for us. You don't feel like another number!We would definitely stay here again, but we will need to remember to book in advance!
Reviews.Author: LeeAnne19

Reviews.Content: Great location Smaller style hotel with a great location fronting the beach with good access to beach, restaurants and shopping. Rooms small but clean and all had a balcony or equivalent. Restaurant food very disappointing and most nights would not see anyone dining there when all other restaurants around were frequented. Found drinks relatively pricey when compared to others around. Staff often in short supply and no drinks service at the pool nearest reception. TV channels very limited
Reviews.Author: Raydale

Reviews.Content: A interesting stay Overall our stay at the Puri Raja was great. The staff were very polite and helpful and the grounds were well kept with beautiful gardens and two nice pools. Breakfast was served in the beachside resturant and offered the traditional Balinese as well as American style food. (Vegemite was supplied for the Australians!!) The only negative with our stay was a smell in our bathroom every afternoon. I assume it came from the bathroom drain and seemed to be strongest in the afternoon. Friends were also staying at the hotel during the same time and their rooms were odour free.
Reviews.Author: natralatraveller

Reviews.Content: Excellent value! Comparing this hotel with the rest around the Kuta and Legian area this place gives the most bang for the buck. The breakfast could be better but the view from the resturant makes up for it in a heart beat. When I return to Bali I will defintely stay here again. Its ok for kids, the kiddy pool is a little deep and there was only one kid channel on the T.V. but the kids didnt mind at all. It was quiet and acomidating to all our needs as a family. Cant wait to go back.
Reviews.Author: MHutapea

Reviews.Content: Best value 3 star on the Legian beachfront       Pool and restaurant
Reviews.Author: Aus2Argie

Reviews.Content: Very pleasant  We ended up at the Puri Raja after a fairly hectic (but superb) journey across Java, so were looking to kick back for a few days.This hotel footed the bill perfectly. The rooms were very pleasant, the breakfast restaurant fronts onto the beach, and the pools (particularly the more functional pool towards the centre of the hotel) were superb.Getting around to Kuta, Legian and Seminyak was simple, and getting away from the south to explore the island was pretty straight forward with plenty of tour agencies and car/bike rentals on the door step.If you're looking for somewhere to relax in Bali I'd recommend here.
Reviews.Author: boytaylor

Reviews.Content: Lovely I don't think we actually have any real complaints about this hotel. Yes the breakfast thing is a little different - its not a buffet like the others - but you get to choose from the menu up to a certain value, so my favourite combo was to get a mixed omlette with a banana pancake (different plate) and a lemon juice. We found the hotel clean. The pools nice, but kind of small, but then again its not a big hotel complex. The location is fantastic. Staff great. Don't have to walk up to a 3rd floor as its only double story buildings, and also this made it quite quiet - but there is no lift at all so anyone with disabilty would have a problem being upstairs, and also our room had a shower/bath set up so that can be awkward for some as well. The gardens are really nice and simple layout - don't get too lost. I do recommend this hotel. I will be on my shortlist when I return.
Reviews.Author: balimarch08

Reviews.Content: Puri Raja was excellent Clean, friendly, quiet  happy. The main pool was never over crowded therefore you could always get a lounge bed  if you wanted total peace you could go the other pool (kids never at this pool). Every night my son would swim two laps of the pool, usually about 10-11pm when we got back.There are safes in all the rooms.The food was OK, but I like eating at as many places as I can findAt one end of the hotel is the beach were the main pool  restaurant is  the other end is a road with shops. I think it is the best of both worlds.It only has ground floor  1st floor. The ground floor is much better with kids.A few people we met had stayed there before  it was our 2nd time. I would stay there again.KerriPS. I didn't get lost in the grounds as there is only one path. Straight
Reviews.Author: scarikerri

Reviews.Content: Best Budget in Bali I have travelled to Bali many times since 1980  stayed at both budget  five star accomodation, I would have to say that the Puri Raja Hotel in Legian is probably one of the best value for money hotels in Bali. We travelled there in September 2007 for my 50th birthday  were very impressed by the service, the quality of the rooms  the location is sensational, far enough away from the hustle  bustle of Kuta but walking distance to everything. We were duly impressed with the breakfast which were able to choose whatever we wanted on the menu. The pools smaller one located at the front of the hotel with swim up bar  larger lap pool at the back were spotless and well maintained everyday. the staff were courteous  friendly, I stayed at the Padma the year before which isonly a stroll down the road but 3 times the price and found the service there not as good and the patrons unfriendly. The tourists staying tat the Puri Raja were friendly and we often sat around in the afternoons by the pool chatting. I have booked to go back in September this year 2008 with my daughter and am looking forward to returning its only the second time I have stayed in the same place twice...... I have emailed the hotel directly and requested a room and they sent me an email straight back. Very Impressed!!!! I love it  would recommend it to any of my friends and I have already!!!!! Hammo26
Reviews.Author: Hammo26

Reviews.Content: Has its Faults. Ive stayed in many hotels in Bali  I booked as a result of trip advisor feedback but I found it with faults. The toilets  drainage stank probably due to the wet weather but they couldnt move us until 1 day before we were due to leave. The breakfast was totally untantillising. We ended up going next door to the Melasti  paying for there buffet or eating elsewhere. The only swimup bar always had loads of pumped up 90's techno blasting near the massage hut. Also, there were huge stairs to get in and huge stairs to get out. They charged twice the 'charge up bill' and we had to locate all our hand written receipts upon checkout. It was just extremely dissapointing. The good points - it was quiet (away from the pool, restaurant  massage hut) and the manicure/pedicure  massage's were very cheap.
Reviews.Author: Lazy-Days425

Reviews.Content: Clean Hotel and Friendly Staff We have previously stayed at Puri Raja back in March 2004, all rooms have been given a paint and the bath rooms have been renovated -so everything looks nice and new. The pool bar has friendly staff -always happy and ready to make you the cocktail of your choice. There are two swimming pools at this resort the only problem we found was that people would leave their towels on the lounge chairs early in the morning, go out and not come back till sometimes 3pm, as there are not enough lounge chairs by the pool for all staying in the resort i found this extremely annoying.Many Aussies stay at this resort as it good value for money, very resonable for room service and all the staff are always friendly and smiling.We are booking our next trip for September 2008.
Reviews.Author: Mich060470

Reviews.Content: Good value beach front hotel, good for kids. Good size, clean rooms. Well decorated. Fairly comfortable. We had 2 rooms on 1st floor - private balconies. Travelled with wife and 3 children (16, 13, 10) - all impressed with hotel. Nice-looking place. Long, 2 storey building with hundreds of tropical trees and shrubs (tropical ginger, frangipani etc). 2 good pools. Restaurant fronting boardwalk - excellent value and very good food. Excellent service. Pool table and table tennis for the (frequent!) rainy periods. Booked DVD players too for even longer rainy days.
Reviews.Author: billturn

Reviews.Content: The Best Budget Hotel! This is the second time I have stayed at the Puri Raja and it won't be the last! The location is excellent, the rooms/ bathrooms clean and modern, breakfast is delicious with a beautiful view to the beach, the gardens are meticulous and the staff are fantastic. My family (2 adults 2 children- 5  7) stayed in interconnecting rooms for 1 week before trying other hotels and we wish we had stayed longer. The Puri Raja is quite a small hotel and very friendly. Most of the other guests seemed to be repeat customers too.
Reviews.Author: L.Northam

Reviews.Content: Good Value for Money We stayed at Puri Raja in late October in a Deluxe Room. In general I would say that the location was good and the hotel was very good value for money. The service was fairly good and the rooms were reasonably clean. It is not 5 star but it was very comfortable and bang for buck.This resort didnt attract much of a classy crowd (ie loud drunks) when we were there. But everyone was really friendly and it was a good sized hotel.... not too small and not too big.I would recommend Puri Raja to anyone looking for a reasonably nice and clean place to stay. If you want good value, this would be quite unbeatable. So long as you werent expecting a very quiet and romantic 5 star resort.
Reviews.Author: TheParrys

Reviews.Content: Love Puri Raja Puri Raja Hotel is a great hotel in the centre of Legian. A la carte breakfast is served with views of the beach. The pool, rooms and bathrooms have all been renovated and is very modern with great amenities for the price.Prices for drinks, massages, pedicures etc are only slightly more than the beach and certainly cheaper than other same price hotels. This encourages lots of guests to stay in the hotel during the day making the pool and masseurs very busy.A great hotel for the location, price and Bali service!
Reviews.Author: MJHoneymoon

Reviews.Content: puri raja excellent value We have just returned from a week at the Puri Raja. The hotel ws very busy whilst we were there, but you wouldn't have known as it wa s very peaceful and quiet. It was great to have 2 pools-one being about 15m long for lapping in. We had a problem with our fridge and literally within in mins of advising housekeeping, there was someone there to fix it..actually, just put in a new one!! Everyone spoke great english and the breakfasts were fantastic. A very pleasant stay.
Reviews.Author: traveller275

Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel We stayed at Puri Raja for five nights. Arrived early hours of the morning - staff were waiting and very quickly booked us in and took us to our room. The gardens at the hotel are beautiful, lots of flowers, plants and very tranquil. The rooms were very comfortable and we were upstairs and notice that every room has either a balcony or porch - a good place to relax. There are two pools, one with a bar near the restaurant and the other a little more sedate. The food was great, we booked in for the sunday night bbq - with plenty of seafood and great value. We will definately stay there again.
Reviews.Author: ColleenNewcastle

Reviews.Content: Watch out for the stairs............ My husband  i first went to Bali in June 2005. We stayed at the Mandira in Legion and we couldnt fault it.After getting married we flew to Bali the next day this time at the Puri Raja. Friends of ours (14 of them) booked their trip for September this year at the Puri Raja it did come recomended to us.Compared to the Mandira the extent to which we could communicate with the staff at the Puri Raja was limited. Remembering this was our honeymoon - we left our hotel room at around 8:00am without showering we had breakfast at the hotel (NOT RECOMENDED) then went down to the beach. When we returned to our room the cleaner had already been into the room without us leaving a sign on the door and of course without us having showers!!! It took them 8 hours to return to actually clean our room again after we had complained. It was extremely difficult to explain to the staff why it wasnt on for them to come into out room without us leaving a sign on the door.The overall set up of the hotel is pretty good as far as prettyness  goes. There are no lounge charis etc at the front of the hotel that you can sit on, relax and look out onto the beach without getting bothered by the locals.My husband almost broke his arm on the steps which are covered but stupidly designed water pours down them if it rains  they are not anti slip. We plan to return to Bali next year and we definately will not be staying at the Puri Raja. Your better of paying a little bit more to stay at the Mandira or Padma or head further towards Kuta and stay in a hotel thats cheaper than the Pur Raja and you wont be so dissapointed with what you paid for.
Reviews.Author: jkm1

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Location We stayed at the Puri Raja this May, It was recomended by our travel agent due to the new referbishment. The hotel rooms were spotless, very clean  the bathroom had an amazing shower, bath and also very clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. The restuarant open 24 hours and nice food. The hotel has 2 swimming pools, both very clean and relaxing. The hotel was packed while we were there and it didn't feel crowded. overall a great holiday at a great hotel. Cheers puri raja. we will come back.
Reviews.Author: camo2004

Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean  Just back from 10 days staying in this hotel and cannot recommend it highly enough. Clean, fresh, pleasant staff, beautiful outlook, lovely pools - perfect....and quiet too.
Reviews.Author: MalenyDeb

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Just returned from the Puri Raja where we had 12 days there in mid January. I travelled with my husband (we're in our 40's) and 3 teenage children. We went with another couple and their teenage son. I booked it on the internet, not expecting a great deal as it was reasonably cheap. We were pleasantly surprised! Great helpful staff who were great fun and very flexible, beautiful gardens, nice, roomy, clean, refurbished rooms, (don't know what the other person was talking about with hard mattresses on the bed in his review - we didn't have a problem) Our rooms were close to the pool (at the beach end), I would definitely suggest getting a room at that end rather than the street end.Meals and drinks etc were good and cheap enough for the kids to order frequently without giving us a heart attack at the end when we had to pay our bill on checkout.There were mainly aussies there who we met and had a great time with. We didn't find it noisy or loud and annoying like the other person did, and I am a couple of years older than them. Maybe we had a more behaved crowd. I was a bit disappointed that there wasn't a buffet breakfast, but there was still a good choice and it was quick. Hotel was probably about 60% full so maybe that was why it was better. A manicure and pedicure whilst sitting at the pool only cost $7.00 for both - a bargain. The DVD shop right out the front across the road was fantastic, give them your list and any others you want and pick up before you leave, they will test every single dvd for you and give you only good quality ones, we haven't had one dodgy dvd yet - all great quality so far. We have stayed at quite a few places in Bali and this was one of the best. We will definitely go back to Bali and stay there again - providing they keep their prices reasonable!
Reviews.Author: relaxingholidays

Reviews.Content: Puri Raja - Would stay there again !       Puri Raja Bed
Reviews.Author: Peri-Peri-Oz

Reviews.Content: Loved It Stayed at Puri Rajah over christmas with my family and I loved it. It has recently been renovated looks beatifull. Friendly Staff, Friendly Guests I would highly recomend it and give it a 10/10. Allready planning a trip back late this year : )
Reviews.Author: lair

Reviews.Content: Boganville We have been to Bali 14 times, last stayed here before the first bomb in 2002 over the Nyepi Day period  had a great time. The place is now full of Australians  it's just over the top, too much loud talking  carry on for my liking (but you get what you pay for) we normally stay out of the rat race, further up the beach so I guess this is what you get when you are amongst it all. Location is great, walking distance to everything, so that is a definate plus. We stayed over the New Years Period Dec 2006 to Jan 2007  if you like paper thin walls, curtains that dont block out the light in the morning  far too much closeness to other people for my liking then this is for you.Breakfast, well, forget the buffet  if you want to sit down  wait half an hour for a coffee let alone any food  choose either fruit or fruit juce, crossant/danish or hot breakfast, then go for it (I do want to say tho that the hotel was at 100% capacity for new years so maybe the service is better through the year). Anyway, we wont be going back. Maybe I just work too hard or am getting too old (45), but for me now this is not the place, probably in my 20's I'd have a rave review.Everything in the rooms are VERY Clean, but the TV only has a few channels  only one English speaking (no movie channel, despite management saying there is satellite TV).
Reviews.Author: Tes

Reviews.Content: Puri Raja Hotel Leignin Bali The Puri Raja Hotel has just been done up, it is a beautiful place, Small with mostly Australian and New Zealand people staying there, it is our 7 time staying there, we find the staff very friendly, the place is clean and the room are a very good size. There are two pools one has a pool bar and is down where the restuarant is which over looks the beach and the other is at the front of the hotel. The meals there are beautiful and the prices are great. We have just come back from spending Christmas and the New Year there and hope that next year we are able to go again. I think we spent christmas and the New year with half of Perth as they were all staying at the hotel. What a party we had New Years Eve at the hotel. Thank You Puri Raja Hotel and Staff for a wonderful night.You are only a 10 to 15 minute walk into Kuta along the beach, and there are loads of places to eat around where the hotel is. Transport is easy loads of places to do your laundry around there. Find loads of places that have really cold beer and glasses. Great place. Judy and Ray Pollard Perth W.A.
Reviews.Author: kojonup

Reviews.Content: Puri Raja Number 1 The puri Raja has had a total refurbishment and I think puts it above the star rating it has been given.I have been staying there for many yearsas have most of the guests..The position right on beachfront ideal and 2pools a bonus .If you prefer quiet time away from the kids pool.The staff has also been there for many years and hotel owned by local family.Also the best manicure and massages around at a very reasonable price.It is also in esy walking distance of the best restaurants in Legian.
Reviews.Author: betcando

Reviews.Content: Would recommend for first time visitors As first time visitors to Bali I was not quite sure what to expect. I found Puri Raja to be a great choice of accommodation. The staff were excellent and food was reasonably cheap. We are going back in Feb 2007 and staying at Puri Raja again. I believe the resort has had a makeover so it will be interesting to see what they have changed.
Reviews.Author: tsking

Reviews.Content: A nice peaceful place! It was the first trip to Bali for my husband and I. We really enjoyed our stay at the Puri Raja and thought that it was a great hotel. The grounds are beautiful, both pools are very nice, the restaurant was great and it was right on the beach. We took advantage of the ping pong and pool tables as well! We are in our late twenties noticed that we were the youngest guests there by a significant margin, with the exception of children/teenagers traveling with their families. This makes no difference to us, but if you are looking for an upbeat eventful location, you may want to try directly in Kuta. If you are looking for a nice family place, or somewhere that is quiet and on the outskirts of the action, but has easy access to it, then this is a the place for you.
Reviews.Author: ldickson

Reviews.Content: dated but friendly After staying in many different areas of Bali over a number of years we, last visit, stayed in Legian for the first time. The Puri Raja was chosen for it's close proximity to the beach. We found it to be a little dated but clean, which is all we ask for. The staff were friendly and the people we met were nearly all repeat visitors. We are returning this year to Bali and our first 2 weeks will be at the Puri Raja.
Reviews.Author: fidgi53

Reviews.Content: nice, but grubby the Puri Raja was a nice enough hotel, but I found the rooms a bit grubby. The bathrooms weren't very clean (big green mould on wall tiles near bath). Staff very friendly and helpful. Pool was nice, restaurant and breakfast was lovely. We had use of our room till 6pm on the day of departure, then we had to sit in the foyer and wait for pick up. I would highly recommend paying for use of room (extra day tarrif) until pick up.
